JOINT SUShee
As you are my first son, I consider it a gift of love to you and, in return, I intend to give you some property as a gift. I hereby give you the property worth Rs. 3,81,000/- literally three lakhs and fifty-one thousand rupees, which has been inherited by me and has been in my possession since then, as per the schedule below. I have given you the property as per the following schedule. Therefore, from now on, the property as per the following schedule shall belong to you and you and your heirs shall enjoy it with all full rights and duties, neither I nor my heirs shall have any right or liability whatsoever over the property as per the following schedule. This is a written deed of donation given with my consent. Nபுஷ்பாவதிSheet Endorsement

boundaries.boundaryW: On this day, Araveti Nagiri Nagaraju gifted the house to Araveti Nagiri Nagaveni

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 575 of 2026, dated 24/Jan/2026, executed by Nagiri Puspaawathi, in favour of her Elder Son, Talari Rangaraju, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 61.11 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 1-112, Assessment No. 196462000380, comprised in survey number 254, situated in Kadavakallu Village and Panchayat, Putluru Mandal, within the District of Anantapur, registered at sub-registrar office Thadipatri is bounded as follows: North by: Kota Wall South by: Rastha East by: House of N. Narendra West by: House to Araveti Nagiri Nagaveni Note *Schedule property is part of Gramakantam as per recitals of the deed.
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
